fields.description: It would be nice to have a 'releases' tab on the branch/tag selector on the commits page that shows the tags that in the semver versioning format.  Alternatively, If the tags could be displayed sorted lexicographically, that would work as well.
fields.summary: create a 'releases' tab in the branch/tag selector on the commits page

fields.description: When I submit a pull request and it gets declined, that becomes a to-do list item for me, because I need to fix and reopen it. But it never goes into any sort of queue that is visible to me in the UI; it just sort of disappears into the abyss, and every day I have to peruse the Declined list to see whether there's anything in there that's mine.
fields.summary: As an author, I want my declined pull requests to be more apparent to me

fields.description: When I'm a pull request reviewer, I make one of three decisions: approve, decline, or "abstain" - by which I mean that I remove myself from the review because either I don't have time or I'm not familiar enough with the code to contribute any meaningful input to that pull request. Approve and decline are easy, but it takes several steps to abstain. It would be great if I could do that in one click.
fields.summary: I would like a button to quickly add/remove myself as a reviewer
Allow users to be created in any of the available directories

fields.description:
Perl installation instructions seems to be missing from

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Installing+Stash+on+Windows
fields.summary: Perl installation instructions
Include a text/plain alternative section in emails from Stash

fields.description:
The following Atlassian Stash documentation article, https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Running+Stash+as+a+Linux+service, provides a script to start and stop Stash via the service command.

The script makes use of a command called "log_daemon_msg."  When the command is run:
  service stash start

Errors appear:
  /etc/init.d/stash: line 80: log_end_msg: command not found
fields.summary: log_daemon_msg: command not found (/etc/init.d/stash: line 77)

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of November 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#deebff|titleBGColor=#deebff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone, thank you for all the feedback on this suggestion. 

Repository archiving feature is under development and is planned for release quite soon. More information on upcoming features and release dates can be found in [Data Center Public Roadmap.|https://www.atlassian.com/roadmap/data-center?product=bitbucket]

Cheers,
Anton Genkin
Product Manager
{panel}
h3. Original description

To decrease clutter and preserve the state of a repository at the time work was completed, it would be useful to be able to archive a repository or project. An archived project/repo may be hidden from lists and search results by default, indicate its archived status and/or would be read only.

One possible workaround for managing the access side of things is to make the whole project readonly, and then use repository permissions to grant additional access to certain repositories, but this means editing all repositories just to reduce access to one.
fields.summary: Allow a repository or project to be archived

fields.description:
User A forks a repository under his name: userA/repository.
Then userA grants access via groups and via individual users.
User B (member of the authorized group) doesn't see userA/repository.
Same with individual user.

Actually, the way to see it is to change the URL to xxxx/users/userA, then to see the accessible repository of user A and to select the one that interests us.
Is there another way? What are we doing wrong?
fields.summary: Cannot grant access to private repositories

fields.description: Repository permissions is a very useful feature, but also risky since repository admins are able to delete repositories. It may cause a conflict in many bigger organizations. Repository admins should not be able to remove repository. This I believe should be restricted to Project Admins.
fields.summary: Repository Admin - delete repository

fields.description:
Stash 2.5 now supports .mailmap as per our [release notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Stash+2.5+release+notes] and [this|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/STASH-3084] JAC feature request. But there is no other doc related to it.
I understand that there is no UI in Stash for this feature but it would be great to have it linked from somewhere in user and group management doc page for people who'd like to use it.
An example or a link to some online docs would be really helpful too.
As a reference, [this|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHKB/Git+or+Hg+Repository+exceeds+number+of+allowed+Committers] is how FECRU does it.
fields.summary: Document .mailmap feature

fields.description:
In Fisheye, the commit diff shows the commit shows the surrounding text and the commit associated with that text. Could something like this also be extended in Stash?

See the commit revisions in and attached smudged screenshot:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Viewing+file+content
fields.summary: The ability to view blame in the diff view

fields.description:
Hi,

It would be nice to have the commit history for specific directory as available by Fisheye. For example, under Fisheye one can explore specific folder and then open up Activity tab which will list commits done in the currently viewed folder.

If one clicks on Commits option under Stash, all commits are shown for the entire repo, instead of the commit history for the currently viewed directory as with Fisheye.
fields.summary: Show commits history for selected directory rather than the entire repo

fields.description:
There have been some reports where users can get locked out of Stash if the configured external user directory server is moved to another IP and internal user directory is disabled.
The only way to workaround this is to hack the database to enable the internal user directory and move it to the top of the precedence list to be able to use internal users to log back into the application. Another workaround is to update the respective database entry to point to the correct IP.
fields.summary: Users can be locked out of Stash if external user directory is moved to another IP

fields.description:
I'd like to see the description for the project I'm looking at.

I had a problem where I didn't know why a the "jira-issue-nav-plugin" repository existed in the "Atlassian" project, because it exists on BitBucket too. Had I been able to read the description I would have been able to understand.
fields.summary: Show project description when viewing a project.

fields.description: See screenshot.
fields.summary: Fork sync make 'null' in merge commit message

fields.description:
!http://f.cl.ly/items/051p0r402L2p0t2w3U1h/Image%202013.07.30%206%3A09%3A20%20PM.png!

This _really_ looks like a Confluence page... should we put some source tags in there to make it look more code-like "< />"
fields.summary: View source icon looks like a Confluence document

fields.description:
The integrated REST-API Browser is very incomfortable to use:

* Opening the REST-API browser within STASH opens the API-Browser with the alphabetically FIRST API-Interface available  (in my example I installed Applinks-plugin - therefore opening API-Browser starts with "Applinks Product Plugin"-Interface.
=> Feature request: Don't start on alphabetically first API-Interface by default  - better: start on last opened Interface

* Passing arguments to REST requests within the interface is not available on many commands! For example exploring "Atlassian Stash REST Plugin": within the "GET /projects/{projectKey}/repos" there is a parameter field "projectkey" available to pass a projectkey to the REST-API. In many other places this field is missing: for example "GET /projects/{projectKey}/permissions/users" does not offer an inputfield for project key (just one example among many).
Those missing input-fields for REQUIRED(!) parameters makes the API-Browser unusable in many places.
=> BUG: Make missing required parameter inputfields available!

* A lot of arguments are either not documented or either wrong placed.
For example:  exploring "Atlassian Stash REST Plugin". - "GET /projects/{projectKey}/permissions/users" has an input-field "filter" - which is either wrongly placed or not documented ...
=> BUG: parameters/arguments should either be documented or removed if they are at the wrong place

* Executing a query (JSON-representation) opens a webpage showing the JSON-result within the same browser tab. Pressing the Browser "Back" button opens the REST-API Browser start page on the top of the page with the entered parameters lost ...
For example: Starting REST-API-Browser opens  "Applinks Product Plugin" Interface in my case (as described above). Navigating to "Atlassian Stash REST Plugin" Interface and performing a command with parameters (for example "GET /projects/XXX") opens a page with the expected json response within the same tab. Pressing the Browser-"Back" button goes back to the Rest-API-Browser start page "Applinks Product Plugin" , Top of the page...
-> BUG: I would expect pressing the "BACK" button to restore the previous state (in example above: " "Atlassian Stash REST Plugin" page with GET /projects/{projectKey}/ as current position and "XXX" as parameter within the parameter box ...

In the current state the REST-API browser is nearly unusable in my eyes.
fields.summary: REST-API Browser glitches

fields.description:
Checking Plugin compatibility is something that needs to be improved.
Unless plugins offer information about STASH-version range they are designed for, this information seems not to be used by STASH to automatically disable plugins (or give hints about possible incompatibilities)

On nearly each update of STASH I ran into problems caused by incompatible plugins - these problems mostly occur in situations, where the plugin is involved, but this is not obvious in the most cases. 
It's a pain to locate this problems.

I think it would be more useful to disable incompatible plugins on STASH-update - or show a big warning about incompatibility on "manage plugins"-page. Handling incompatible plugins like firefox does would be preffered ... (disabling on incompatibility - automatic checking for updates ...)
fields.summary: Improved checking of plugin compatibility

fields.description:
After a customer raised an issue, I worked with [~ssaasen] and we couldn't find in our documentation any constraints to the size of Git repos. 

We should document some general guidelines regarding repository sizes and large files.
fields.summary: Documentation improvement - constraints to Git Repo Size

fields.description:
After some time, without important load, Stash crash with Too many open files errors in catalina.out (you can download a complete version of the log file here: http://extranet.ttree.ch/~dfeyer/catalina.out.gz)

Stash run on OSX 10.6 / JAVA 6
# uname -a
Darwin everest.intranet.ttree.ch 10.8.0 Darwin Kernel Version 10.8.0: Tue Jun  7 16:33:36 PDT 2011; root:xnu-1504.15.3~1/RELEASE_I386 i386

I try to increase the ulimit values, but without any success, stash continue to crash:
# ulimit -a
-t: cpu time (seconds)         unlimited
-f: file size (blocks)         unlimited
-d: data seg size (kbytes)     unlimited
-s: stack size (kbytes)        8192
-c: core file size (blocks)    0
-v: address space (kb)         unlimited
-l: locked-in-memory size (kb) unlimited
-u: processes                  2000
-n: file descriptors           32768

Does Stash need more thant 32768 open files ? We dont host more than 40 repository. Some projects are big, but mainly average size project. We have a bit less than 3 Go of data in our Stash home directory.

Thanks for your help
fields.summary: Stash crash after some hours on OS X server
Could not initialize class com.sun.xml.bind.v2.model.impl.RuntimeModelBuilder

fields.description: It would be very nice with an announcement banner for Stash like the one for Jira.
fields.summary: Announcement Banner

fields.description:
As discussions on https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/191749/how-to-get-the-names-of-licensed-users on https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/195495/freeing-unused-stash-licenses show, admistration of licensed users is not easily possible for STASH-admins.

Having STASH configured to allow ActiveDirectory users to login, results in difficulties/impossibilities to:
* get an list of all users who do use a license (https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASHKB/Determine+the+users+that+currently+occupy+Stash+license+seat. gives a workaround for this - but I think this should be accesible more easy (GUI/Rest interface)
* remove obsolete users from the list of users who hold an license

For more details see the discussions mentioned above.

Feature request: make administration of user licenses possible and more easy to access
fields.summary: Administrating licensed users

fields.description: I would like to be able to delete projects that have repos in them.  Right now, I have to delete each repo by hand, and then delete the project.  I would like a button on the project, to delete it and all repos under it.
fields.summary: Allow users to delete projects with repos

fields.description:
I would like to be able search the contents of repositories not just files 
Is it currently possible or is it d future planned enhancement.

If not is it possible to build a plugin to piggyback or hook into the indexing and index the file contents?
fields.summary: Is it possible to extend the repository indexing to include file contents?

fields.description:
Numbered lists do not render correctly, and indentation is missing from the current markdown renderer. Attached is a screenshot of the problem, and the example input: {code} 1. Numbered item 1 * Sub-list 1. Numbered item 2 * Sub-list 1. Numbered item 3 * Sub-list {code} Results in the following invalid HTML output: {code:html}
  1. Numbered item 1
  • Sub-list
  1. Numbered item 2
  • Sub-list
  1. Numbered item 3
  • Sub-list
{code} Compare with expected output (using Github as an example): {code:html}
  1. Numbered item 1
    • Sub-list
  2. Numbered item 2
    • Sub-list
  3. Numbered item 3
    • Sub-list
{code} In both HTML cases I changed whitespace indentation to be consistent for comparison.
fields.summary: Invalid markdown list rendering

fields.description:
After creating a new repository within Stash, and attempting the following via command line in an existing git repo:
{code}
git remote set-url origin https://ccoker@stash.example.com/scm/uxg/mako.git
git push --all
{code}

...the following error occurs:
{code}
Password for 'https://ccoker@stash.example.com':
Counting objects: 15648, done.
Delta compression using up to 8 threads.
Compressing objects: 100% (9705/9705), done.
Writing objects: 100% (15648/15648), 29.32 MiB | 2.45 MiB/s, done.
Total 15648 (delta 8213), reused 11461 (delta 5282)
remote: Could not create socket to ping Stash: Connection timed out
To https://ccoker@stash.example.com/scm/uxg/mako.git
 ! [remote rejected] master -> master (pre-receive hook declined)
error: failed to push some refs to 'https://ccoker@stash.example.com/scm/uxg/mako.git'
{code}
fields.summary: pre-receive hook error when pushing to https URL

fields.description:
A user needs to have the write permission for a branch to do the merge into at the end of a pull request. That's very logical. 
We would like to prevent developing anything directly on develop. Therefore no user has write permission on develop but on any feature branch. If all quality criteria are meet (e.g. review, Jenkins build, etc.) the merge on the develop branch can be made for a given feature branch. Any developer can be a reviewer and also any developer should be able to start the merge if all quality criteria are meet. 
Here is our problem. The developer has no write permission for the develop branch and therefore can not press the Merge button in stash.
What are your suggestions to deal with this issue? Could Stash uses a configured technical user for the merge, so the loged in user does not need the write permissions on the develop branch?
fields.summary: Branch Permissions for Pull Requests

fields.description:
The current REST API allows one to get the files within a repository by walking the tree. I would like to be able to update a file from the REST api, and have this create a new commit on the specified branch.

See, for example, this API from GitHub: http://developer.github.com/v3/repos/contents/#update-a-file
fields.summary: Update/Create files from REST API

fields.description:
Something like this for Stash would be very helpful to keep track of the "end of support" announcements:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/End+of+Support+Announcements+for+JIRA
fields.summary: Create an "End of Support Announcements for Stash" page

fields.description:
When a branch is deleted from an upstream repository, forks of that repository which are using the 'fork synchronization' feature automatically prune their copies of these branches if they are unchanged from the state of the removed branches in the upstream repository. This is unsafe, because it implies the following sentiment:

"The upstream repository is no longer interested in this branch, therefore none of my forks should be interested in it either."

At very least, this should be a separate setting. Otherwise, it's likely that work may be lost if the developer (as I do) routinely uses 'git fetch --all -p' to keep up to date with the status of their remotes, and does not keep local tracking branches for all of the outstanding branches on their personal fork.

In short, automatic update is safe and useful (because all of the commit history remains reachable), but automatic pruning is harmful because it allows the upstream maintainer to (even accidentally) destroy his downstream forks' data.
fields.summary: Provide an additional option for fork syncing to switch off automatically pruning of downstream branches

fields.description: It would be nice to have syntax highlighting for perl source files. A lot of projects use perl scripts and modules. A good portion of Git itself is written in perl.
fields.summary: Syntax highlight .pm extensions as Perl

fields.description: As a reviewer, I'd like the ability to mark a comment as representing a defect that must be fixed. This should prevent anyone from merging the PR.
fields.summary: Ability to Mark Defects on a Pull Request
LicenseServiceImpl#onGroupMembershipCreatedEvent performs potentially expensive operations causing slow LDAP synchronization
Outer sessions are not flushed during crowd synchronization slowing them down significantly for large directories

fields.description: When searching for repositories, the results are often cut off due to not making use of the available screen space (see attached screen shot).  It would be nice for this to be larger or have an option to open on a results page which can show full content.
fields.summary: search results don't take advantage of available screen space

fields.description:
Since STASH-2481 (Branch Permissions) were implemented I've been extremely happy with the ability to finely tune permissions for branches.

However, this quickly became very time consuming which brings me to...

I would love the ability to setup Branch Permissions, but at the Project level.  These would be applied automatically to all child repositories.  It would only allow Apache Ant patterns as described [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH024/Branch+permission+patterns].

This would allow quick changes to be made without consuming too much time.  This is useful when you follow a specific workflow\permission scheme across your entire project and don't want to waste time applying it to each and every repository.  In my actual user case, I had to apply the exact same Branch Permissions 6 times to 18 different repositories (total 108) for a single project.
fields.summary: Branch Permissions per Project

fields.description:
The commit message looks weird when sync merges instead of fast forwards. Example from git log:

commit 140a801bb753019425fa87dd7576ef88028419a1
Merge: 779d6df 69d0ceb
Author: Kalle Kula <xxx@yyy.zzz>
Date:   Wed Jul 24 14:15:38 2013 +0200

    null

    * commit '69d0ceb7a64e875c7f8c0dc0ec331a71c557c3f6':
      Added a line in mother repo



Workflow:

1. Make a fork (B) of repo A.
2. Make a commit in fork B and push it to Stash
3. Make another commit in repo A, but make sure it's NOT going to result in a merge conflict that the user needs to handle when synced to fork B, i.e change two different files.
4. Do a "manual" sync in Stash of the fork, since it couldn't be done automatically by Stash.
5. And here I get the "null" message in the fork.
fields.summary: Fork sync issue, creates a merge commit with message that starts with "null"

fields.description: Searching for a filename such as "null_somename.txt" will render the filename as "$1_somename.txt" in Stash.
fields.summary: Stash search renders filenames with "null" as "$1"

fields.description: When reviewing diffs, the last line of code is cut off if a long line of code causes horizontal scrolling and if the code length is at least as long as the preview box size. In the attached image, the vertical scrollbar is at its maximum and the 103rd line is visible, whilst Firebug reveals there is a 104th line hidden behind the horizontal scrollbar.
fields.summary: Horizontal scrollbar chops off code at bottom of diff page

fields.description: Enabling Application navigator in Stash, it use the Application Url instead of the Display URL.
fields.summary: Application navigator use wrong URL

fields.description: When a project is created, create a confluence wiki page and link between the stash project and the wiki page to allow documentation/design to flow between.  Similarly for repositories within the project.  Might be subpages?
fields.summary: Create and link to a confluence wiki page on Project Create

fields.description:
The customer reported the scenario below:

1. Push a commit to Stash on BRANCH-1.
2. Create Pull-Request to Master from BRANCH-1
3. Reviewers (including InfoSec) reviews and approves Pull-Request
4. Push BAD code to Stash on BRANCH-1, Stash updates Pull-Request with new commit code.
5. Now you don't need any further approval, since everyone approved the
original Pull-Request.
6. Code, including BAD code, can now be merged without review. That's
BAD, even if you explicitly trust the people writing the code. 
----------------------

From what I understood from him and simulated myself, on the step 5 it makes sense that the approval flags should be removed - hence the Pull Request should be reviewed again.

We should make the approval process customisable via a workflow.
fields.summary: Pull request approval workflow
UserCreatedEvent should be transaction aware

fields.description:
Was just thinking that something that could really differentiate Stash from its competitors would be the ability to have it be able to support language-specific/project specific code interrogation (i.e. click on a method and be able to browse to its implementation). Maybe by working together with IntelliJ, the Eclipse Foundation/Eclipse dev team(s), Rational, etc. there might be a way to allow Stash to take advantage of IDE-like code browsing behavior.

I totally understand that this would be incredibly difficult to implement. It is one of those "wouldn't it be nice if..." features to be able to really see what is going on in the code when doing a code review using Stash instead of something like IDea's IDEtalk which isn't git/pull request aware.

Maybe an easier version of this could be to integrate Stash with an IDE so that you could have a stash plugin in the IDE that would be aware of a pull request in Stash, could clone the repo, copy it, checkout each repo version in each directory so it was pointed at the before/after commit ids, then copy the IDE's project files, reindex for each version in each IDE project, and then you could see each version of the code easily. But, doing it this way would be painful to wait on for the developer; it would be *much* easier to just click on something in the git diff in Stash instead (so the Stash server would handle all of the copying/cloning/checking out/etc. required to allow such behavior).

Some real "out of the box" thinking on this one. ;)
fields.summary: Language aware code navigation

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – December 2017|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hi everyone,

We have recently reviewed this issue and the overall interest in the problem. As the issue hasn't collect votes, watchers, comments, or support cases from many customers during its lifetime, it's very low on our priority list, and will not be fixed in the foreseeable future. That's why we've decided to resolve it as *Timed Out*.

Although we're aware the issue is still important to those of you who were involved in the conversations around it, we want to be clear in managing your expectations. The Bitbucket Server team is focusing on issues that have broad impact and high value, reflected by the number of comments, votes, support cases, and customers interested. Please consult the [Atlassian Bugfix Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-bug-fixing-policy-201294573.html] for more details.

We understand how disappointing this decision may be, but we hope you'll appreciate our transparent approach and communication. If you're really passionate about this suggestion, please comment with your case in detail and we'll reconsider. Atlassian will continue to watch this issue for further updates, so please feel free to share your thoughts in the comments.

Thank you,

Imran Khan
Product Manager - Bitbucket Server and Data Center
{panel}

As a user, I'd like to be able to create a pull request without having to navigate to the project.

It would be nice to have a global pull request button. The pull request dialog includes a drop-down for selecting a project. I'd like that drop down to allow me to select any project (with search functionality probably) so that I could create a pull request from anywhere. It should probably default to the current project if you came from a project page.
fields.summary: Create Pull Requests From Anywhere

fields.description:
Currently com.atlassian.stash.internal.auth.DefaultCaptchaService#onUserCreated resets the CAPTCHA failed authentication attempts when a user is created. This event is a synchronous event and happens inside transactions which occur during LDAP synchronisation which in turn triggers slow isDirty checks in hibernate.

It is recommended that we remove this event listener as it provides little value in a scenario which is an edge case
fields.summary: DefaultCaptchaService#onUserCreated can be slow when synchronising large LDAP directories

fields.description:
We'd like to enable public sign-ups for our open-source Stash installation.

We have Crowd hooked into both our internal LDAP directory, as well as an extranet-only LDAP tree. With read/write support, users could create accounts directly from Stash.

This is currently supported by JIRA, where we have it enabled.
fields.summary: Implement read/write support for Crowd directories
Stash keyboard shortcut for the inbox should be consistent with Confluence

fields.description:
A built-in Wiki would be nice.
Like https://bitbucket.org/geckofx/geckofx/wiki/Home
fields.summary: A built-in Wiki

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of March 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#deebff|titleBGColor=#deebff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi all,

I'm excited to share that in Bitbucket Server 7.0 we shipped redesigned and optimized pull request page with several improvements you’ve been asking us. Icons in the diff file-tree have much cleaner and contrast design, which was tested on colorblind users. We believe you will find new experience much more satisfying.

You can find more information in the Bitbucket Server 7.0 [release notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/bitbucket-server-7-0-release-notes-990546638.html] and Pull Requests [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/review-and-discuss-a-pull-request-808488540.html].

Please, don't hesitate to leave feedback on the feature in the comments. This will help us to priorities further development.

Anton Genkin
Product Manager Bitbucket Server
{panel}
*Original message*

Under the diffs the file structure has color code for files that have been moved, deleted, changed, or added. I believe the colors are green, red, brown, and blue; I have a hard time viewing green, red, and brown, thus out of ease of use, i was hoping for a colorblind mode.
fields.summary: Colorblind Mode for File Structure under Diffs
CallbackLsTreeOutputHandler does not call onEndPage when the git process is interrupted

fields.description:
Hello,

I see that currently some refs are created for each pull request when pulling a repository.
refs/pull-requests/n/from
refs/pull-requests/n/merge
refs/pull-requests/n/merge-clean
refs/pull-requests/n/merge-conflicted
refs/pull-requests/n/to

I'd like to set up a repository hook on pull request creation or rescope. I can see global events matching what I seem to need, like 
com.atlassian.stash.event.pull.PullRequestOpenedEvent or
com.atlassian.stash.event.pull.PullRequestRescopedEvent

however, I don't know when the refs I mentioned earlier are updated. I want to be sure that they are up to date before kicking a build.

Am I on the right track, or is there a simpler solution?

Best regards,

Vincent Latombe
fields.summary: Trigerring of pull requests if merge is clean

fields.description:
Hierarchy from PROJECT to REPOSITORIES for better organisational management.

Currently the stash home page lists Projects and within each project we have Repositories.

Our implementation is the home page has Clients and then we are having to use naming conventions for project and repository ie.

* TNT Supplies
** Accounts-Gui
** Accounts-SecureWebSite
** Cracker-iPhoneApp
** Cracker-Portal
** Cracker-PublicWebSite
** Cracker-WebService

where as if we could have more levels we could do

* TNT Supplies
** Accounts
*** Gui
*** SecureWebSite
** Cracker
*** iPhoneApp
*** Portal
*** PublicWebSite
*** WebService

Maybe one option is to add a client attribute to a project (like a category) but allowing the building of a hierarchy between *project* and *repositories* would be more ideal.

Being able to provide extra info at each level such as a mark down would be great to be able to render a blurb for that level.

Background: we have been migrating from SVN to Stash and have 17 years of projects to ultimately move.  Currently in stash we have started new projects and migrated active projects, but we would like to back haul migrate the rest at some stage if they do not muddy the waters.
fields.summary: Hierarchy from PROJECT to REPOSITORIES for better organisational management
Getting to relevant pull request from JIRA

fields.description:
I recently put the following in a pull request comment and all the newlines were removed:
{code}
```
inline_template('<%=
    servers = []
    @prod_servers.each do |host|
      servers.push(host + ":" + @prod_server_port)
    end
    servers.entries.join(",") %>')
```
{code}
fields.summary: Markdown sometimes removes newlines
Provide navigation from the changeset page back to the context pull request
Support MySQL Cluster

fields.description:
Able to create a repository from Source Tree on a Stash project on which i do not have 'admin' access.

On Stash, only admin access will have option to create repositories, however Source Tree allows users to create repository on a Stash project where users have only 'write' access.

This is a major security concern.
fields.summary: Able to create a repository from Source Tree on a Stash project on which i do not have 'admin' access

fields.description:
We've recently switched from BitBucket to Stash and we really love the improvements. Nonetheless, there's one BitBucket feature we deeply miss in Stash - AJAX notifications about changes to pull requests, like added/deleted/changed commits, new comments, approval/disapproval. I happened to ask colleagues for approval after they've already done so because I got so used to having been notified by a little AJAX popup in the lower-right corner of the window of the change that happened.

Ideally everything would be updated without requiring page refresh: comments, approval status etc. but at the very least a notification about what's changed so that we know we have to refresh the page is needed.
fields.summary: AJAX notifications about comments/new commits/approval in pull requests

fields.description: As an Administrator, I'd like to see Stash commits similarly to how I would see DVCS commits in the GreenHopper Detail pane, as described here. https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Viewing+an+Issue
fields.summary: Provide Commit Tab to GreenHopper similar to DVCS plugin

fields.description:
As a follow-up to STASH-3001 I want to report, that Bug STASH-3001 is not fixed for me (cannot reopen STASH-3001)

Randomly external tools (git clients: sourceTree, TortoiseGit) which try to access Repository on STASH server get access denied - as STASH is asking for CAPTCHA input. As I said this happens randomly - and is a big annoyance within our automatic build environment.

Within the administrative page http://stash:7990/admin/authentication, there is a checkbox available "CAPTCHA on sign up
Enables or disables CAPTCHA verification when a user signs up" - but this box (as well as the corressponding text) is greyed and CANNOT be checked. At the moment its NOT checked.
The "Maximum login attempts" currently is set to 100 ...

I do have full administration rights within STASH (System administrator)
fields.summary: Disable CAPTCHA

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – December 2017|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hi everyone,

We have recently reviewed this issue and the overall interest in the problem. As the issue hasn't collect votes, watchers, comments, or support cases from many customers during its lifetime, it's very low on our priority list, and will not be fixed in the foreseeable future. That's why we've decided to resolve it as *Timed Out*.

Although we're aware the issue is still important to those of you who were involved in the conversations around it, we want to be clear in managing your expectations. The Bitbucket Server team is focusing on issues that have broad impact and high value, reflected by the number of comments, votes, support cases, and customers interested. Please consult the [Atlassian Bugfix Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-bug-fixing-policy-201294573.html] for more details.

We understand how disappointing this decision may be, but we hope you'll appreciate our transparent approach and communication. If you're really passionate about this suggestion, please comment with your case in detail and we'll reconsider. Atlassian will continue to watch this issue for further updates, so please feel free to share your thoughts in the comments.

Thank you,

Imran Khan
Product Manager - Bitbucket Server and Data Center
{panel}

Currently when a commit contains modifications to images, it's only possible to directly compare images by content. 

Please show dimensions (and image depth) for old / new images.
fields.summary: Show dimensions for images in commits
Deleting branch on merge is slow
I18nService and quote symbol

fields.description: Would be very interesting if we could create HA clusters with STASH, or even design upcoming versions to work in a distributed environment.
fields.summary: Add the ability to create HA cluster for STASH.

fields.description:
I would like to have ability to block merge of pull request without closing it.

Gerrit has feature called "i would not submit this"  - it means that pull request shouldn't be merged. Author should correct some bugs, and update pull request before merge.
fields.summary: Block pull request

fields.description:
I am  trying develop Stash Repository Hook (pre receive) with config form.  I try to use the Stash. template.branchSelector.input template in it.

I have learned these sources:
https://developer.atlassian.com/stash/docs/latest/soydoc/branch-selector-field.soy.htm
https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/stash-example-hook-protect-ref/

The last one renders dropdown menu on config-form, but no items inside.
All my experiments in forcing to work BranchSelector were failed.

I am always had hit on bug:
{Uncaught TypeError: Cannot call method 'getProject' of undefined revision-reference-selector.js:181},

when I trying to click on BranchSelector dropdown menu.

More detailed description of my experiments provided in questions:
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/187876/why-doesn-t-branchselector-work
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/188719/may-be-bug-in-branchselector
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/173564/branch-selector


I think that bug reason is that repository-hook doesnt include dependency {com.atlassian.stash.stash-web-api:branch-selector-field}, but it is only my opinion.
fields.summary: Incorrect rendering of BranchSelector in RepositoryHook config-form

fields.description:
Automatically add a user to the reviewers list if they approve/decline a pull request and weren't already on the list.

Scenario:
Team member creates pull request and does not allocate a specific reviewer; leaving the wider team to pick up the review.
A team member then reviews the ticket and approves/merges.

Problem: Without looking at the specific detailed history of a pull request, you cannot see who approved the pull request.
fields.summary: Add reviewer to reviewers list when they approve/decline pull requests

fields.description: I want to customize my search criteria. Really......
fields.summary: Make PullRequestService::search public

fields.description:
Hi there,

It was going to be awesome if we could create branches on Stash repositories directly from UI.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Create branch from Stash UI

fields.description:
As a code-reviewer
I want the act of Merging code, where I am an assigned reviewer to automatically mark my approval 
So that I have one less click to make

The assumption is that anyone using the "Merge" button in the interface has therefore also approved the pull-request.

Perhaps have a tick box (auto-enabled) for "Approve this pull request", which would allow people to optionally bypass the status change; for instance where there is not consensus on a review, and while the majority approve, the person doing the merge is a dissident...
fields.summary: Auto-Approve pull requests on Merge

fields.description:
I am unable to register a new user directory for Atlassian Crowd or Atlassian JIRA. Every time I push the "Test Settings" button, I only receive a blank page with HTTP status header 400/Bad Request. 
None of the logs contain any information about the request.

Reproduce: 
* Open User Directories > Add Directory > Atlassian JIRA
* Fill-in data
* Push "Test Settings"
=> blank page
fields.summary: Blank page after pushing "Test Settings" on "Configure Atlassian JIRA Server" page
Pull Request Inbox

fields.description:
This would allow:
* An admin (or user) to vet which repositories are publicly visible
* An anonymous user to quickly see all the available repositories
fields.summary: Provide a way to see all the repositories that are publicly accessible

fields.description:
- Create an application link between JIRA and Stash.
- Change the Display URL.
- Note that when a commit references a single JIRA issue the URL is correctly generated using the Display URL.
- When more than one JIRA issue is referenced the popup window contains URLs incorrectly generated from the Application URL, not the Display URL.
fields.summary: JIRA issue link not obeying Display URL value in Application Links (JIRA Issues pop-up only)

fields.description:
In the Clone button in the stash web interface, there is a link that reads:
{quote}Need help cloning? [Visit Stash 101|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Getting+started+with+Git+and+Stash]{quote}

The link resolves to https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Getting+started+with+Git+and+Stash where there is a big green button titled 'Watch the movie'.

That green button plays a movie on how to +install+ stash. That probably isn't what the end user is expecting.

Would it be appropriate to change the title of the button to make it clear it is for administrators? Or maybe split the end user and admin content into different pages; then link to the admin content from the admin interface; and the user content from the main interface?
fields.summary: Stash 101 links to instructions on installing stash - not ideal for end users

fields.description:
Hi team,

It was going to be awesome if Stash have the feature to send batch mails instead of sending it immediately like FishEye does.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Batch mails for Stash

fields.description:
Hi there guys,

Bitbucket has a great dashboard interface, but I can't see the same style on Stash.

It was going to be great to users have the same dashboard style.

Regards.
Celso Yoshioka,
Atlassian Support.
fields.summary: Stash DashBoard like bitbucket
Merges from master should _not_ unapprove the PR.

fields.description:
Being able to set permissions a finer levels of entity (Project -> Repo -> Branch) is great, but the Read/Write/Admin levels are too coarse.

For instance, in order to fork a repo, a developer needs to have Admin permissions on a Project (in order to create a new repository). But I don't want them to have Admin permission on all Repositories. In addition, if I want to implement an internal 'GitHub', that allows developers to share their code, I can't do this because they need Admin permissions on a Project in order to create a Repo, which would give them power over all Repos.

So... can we have the ability to define security roles that allow us to define actions that users and groups can perform?
fields.summary: Finer authorization controls than Read/Write/Admin

fields.description:
As a stash-administrator
I want to use the REST API to configure the pull request
So that I can ensure the proper configuration is made across all repositories

Example:

|| URI | /rest/api/1.0/projects/\{projectKey}/repos/\{repositorySlug}/settings/pull-requests |
|| Get | Returns current configuration; ie "0 approvers, 2 builds"
|| Post | set the configuration |

Possible PR configurations:
* The number of required approvals before a PR can be merged.
* The number of required builds before a PR can be merged.
* Unapprove all reviewers when the source branch of a pull request changes (when Stash Auto Unapprove Plugin ins installed)

When adding a REST endpoint, a corresponding Java service should also be exposed.
fields.summary: Rest and service API to manage pull request restrictions

fields.description:
When i connect one of my jira issue to a stash commit. because that jira issue don't have the "Priority" field, when i click on the jira issue key in stash. 
In the pop-up layer, there is nothing displayed...
with fiddler, i found that after i click on the link, the request is responsed correctly, just without any information about priority. So it will occur a javascript error when rendering the pop-up layer.

Expected Result:
Even the target issue don't have some field, the pop-up layer in stash should still display correctly.
fields.summary: Stash/JIRA integration does not work correctly when there is not priority for the linked JIRA issue
Multi-line code blocks don't seem to be working.

fields.description:
Hi Team,

It seems we can not do the following:
Create group1
Add 3 users to group1
Create group2
Add 2 users
Add group1 to group2
In particular, it is the last step we cannot do.
Is there a plan to allow such feature?

Thanks,
fields.summary: Use of Nested Groups

fields.description: It would be great to be able to reply to a comment email from stash and have that reply show up in the pull request discussion.
fields.summary: Comment Reply by Email

fields.description:
I like to add column 'Size' for each commit. Sometimes our repo is growed up by some commits. To find 'fat' commits i need to compute commit's blobs size,

Here is prepared script: https://github.com/sschuberth/dev-scripts/blob/master/git/git-commit-size.sh

I try to create plugin, that will help you to detect some 'fat' commits, what possible was wrong. And also 'fat' branches.
fields.summary: Ability to add column to Commits table from plugin

fields.description:
We need option to merge pull request even if it contains conflicts. Simple fast forward on Automerge conflict in anycase without any hooks and checks.
This ability is required from plugin 'Conflicts Tab'. There are sources:
https://bitbucket.org/lelik/stash-pull-request-conflicts-tab
fields.summary: Ability to Merge pull request with Conflict Markers

fields.description: If we use `git config --global merge.conflictstyle diff3`, then Stash still detect conflicts, but with incorrect behavior. Stash not understand diff3 marker for base common ancestor ('|||||| ').
fields.summary: Support for diff3

fields.description: Currently Stash only supports English. It would be good to support additional languages, with the usual [TAC|https://translations.atlassian.com/] support.
fields.summary: Support language packs
Html in PR comments not encoded

fields.description:
User license entitlement in Stash is not released when a user has been de-activated in Crowd.

Steps to reproduce:
# Start Stash with 10 user license.
# Add user directory from Crowd with > 10 users.
# Synchronise all users and give "Stash User" permission to 10 of them.
# In Crowd de-activate one of the users that has "Stash User" permission.
# In Stash synchronise the user directory.
# Check the license: It is still with "10 (0 users remaining)" and it will be until the de-activated user has been removed even though the user is not able to log in anymore.
fields.summary: De-Activated Users In Crowd Still Count Against the User License

fields.description: When using the '/' character in repository quick search, the 'project' part before the slash does not match against peoples names in order to find repositories in their own personal space.
fields.summary: Repository Quick Search does not match personal 'projects' by name

fields.description:
When using the JIRA User Directory for authentication, 'deactivated' or 'disabled' users from JIRA are synchronized to Stash.

This means the Users view is polluted with users that are not active without any indication that they are or aren't enabled or active.

In addition, it appears that if these users are still in groups authorized for access to Stash, they are counted against your license limit. This requires you to remove 'deactivated' users from the groups to which they belonged to manage you license limit appropriately.
fields.summary: Deactivated users synchronized when using JIRA for authentication

fields.description: When clicking on any *.md file in a repository browse, google chrome barfs and shows only some oddly formatted text.
fields.summary: OSX 10.8.4 Google Chrome Version 27.0.1453.116 fails to render UI when viewing markdown files.

fields.description:
If I have a tag, for example SomeMassivePrefixWordToSearchFor_1234.5, and I search in the tag popup window (in the commits screen), then I have to search with:

SomeMassivePrefixW

rather than any substring part of the tag, such as:

WordToSearchFor

Also it would be nice if we could easily copy the tag or branch (rather than using the browser's url bar).
fields.summary: Tags searching should use substrings

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status – 03 January 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for providing your thoughts and votes on this suggestion. We know it's been a while since this suggestion was raised and we're sorry to have kept you without a clear answer.

Your feedback has really helped us better understand the challenges you face being unable to modify links between commits and  Jira issues. Despite our lack of communication, this problem is actually one of those areas we plan to improve. Right now we've decided to prioritise it on our roadmap.

Thank you again for all your feedback on this suggestion and we look forward to providing you with more updates as we work on the solution.

Best,
Anton Genkin | Product Manager - Integrations
{panel}

*Original request description:*

It should be possible to change the link of a STASH commit to a JIRA issue after it has been pushed to the git server. This way, for example, a wrong or missing commit <-> issue link can be modified or added afterwards.
fields.summary: Modify JIRA link after commit

fields.description:
If the viewed code lines are too long, an horizontal scrollbar appears, in Windows environments regardless of the browser (tested with Chrome and Firefox) the last line is hidden by the scrollbar.

Steps to reproduce:
# Have a file added with some long lines.
# Commit that file or create a pull request.
# View (or comment) the code, having the vertical scrollbar at the bottom.
# Attempt to view the last line.
fields.summary: Horizontal Scrollbar Hides the Last Line

fields.description: My project use GBK encoding, It displayed correctly in  File Browsing. But the commit files (diff) will show lots of '�' instead of correct string.
fields.summary: encoding problem when view commit files
